column4: anyone setup wifi in Lenovo T500 here ? I was running th 8.10 live cd and it doesnt detect my wifi card
which chipset are you using?
I think it might be intel 5300
what is the driver for your wifi should be broadcom or atheros
paul68:its 11b/g Wireless Lan (its Atheros)
do you see the wireless driver in the restricted drivers list?
Currently I am in vista, but the Driver version is 7.6.0.96
I can only help you when you under linux
do you think 8.10 would detect it if I do a full installation ? I mean in live it didnt support it
I understand, I need to go back home and use the livecd again to get into Ubuntu
well it might but can you see the driver in the restricted drivers list
no problem
where is the restricted driver list ? how do I get to that ?
system > administration > hardware drivers
so I try to find under that if there is an aetheros driver ?
yes
if Aetheros is there, then what do I do ? (sorry for asking but I cant connect to internet when I am inside there)
if the driver is there then you know that its supported in 8.10 then you can enable it and use your wifi if that doesn
doesn't work you have to use madwifi
!madwifi |kengine
I will try to find that, but this also looks a good option http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=662877
aha Atheros ath5k wireless driver not enabled by default http://www.ubuntu.net/getubuntu/releasenotes/810
thanks paul68
I'm also learning but yes you can try it
